Comment: Simple and relevant problem that has quite a lot of potential to become a classic puzzle ;)

Sir... you did mistake in line 14 of your code...replace line 14 by:

if(!(lineArray[0]=="/"&&lineArray[1]=="/")){

hey im trying to solve this problem (using python) and im running into an issue (most likely on my part(i only code for fun so im not as experienced))  when the test cases get to the tabs part, it seems to be deleting too much lines of code on my end for example my code outputs in the tabs test case that i should delete 22 lines of code instead of the 19 your answer gives, as i said this problem is likely due to my inexperience but could you please outline if tabs should be treated as multiple spaces or not

I'd also like to ask that you word a part of your explanation differently, in the "Output" section there is what i presume to be a typo where it says "start of end of the lines" im guessing that first "of" should be "or", and it also makes it seem like semi colons should only be deleted if they are in fact at the start or end of the line of code, and not in between the code

Goal
* Please explain how comments are represented for the purpose of this clash.

* There aren't really any tab characters (\t) in the input of all the cases, are there? It's better to explain how tabs are represented for the purpose of this clash, or to explain all the leading spaces in a line (which serve like tabs)  should be ignored.

Cases
* Please remove the trailing newline at the end of the input of Validator 4.

Thanks.

P.S. I didn't comment on the clash before because the test cases had not been finalised.

Goal
* Please mention whether a newline character removed together with the comment before it should be counted as part of the difference (see below sample calculations for example).

Input
* "length" is confusing because you are also using the same word for the length of the given code. Please revise as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[l]] for the number of lines of the original code

Output
* Please change "basic" to "original".

* Please change "start of end" to "start or end".

Constraints
* Please mention that comments never appear in the middle of a line except when a line consists of only leading spaces followed by a comment.

Cases
* Please change the last validator as follows to be similar to the last test:
  â€¢ add spaces before the comment
  â€¢ add space(s) after a line

* For "Both" test:

//Note code below is WEIRD  <- whole line 26
    //realy                 <- whole line 11
let lol = "2015";           <- ; 1
lol.toString();             <- ; 1
if(typeof lol !== "flop"{   <- 0
    console.log("go away"); <- spaces 4 + ; 1 = 5
    delete lol;             <- spaces 4 + ; 1 = 5
}                           <- ending space 1

total = 26 + 11 + 1 + 1 + 5 + 5 + 1 = 50

Why is the output 43? Have you treated a tab of 4 spaces as 1 character? But there aren't any tab (\t) characters ðŸ¤”

For "Validator 4":
//Last but not least               <- whole line 20
const k=readline();                <- ; 1
for(let i=0;i<k;i++){              <- 0
    const h=readline();            <- spaces 4 + ; 1 = 5
    if(h**i==k){                   <- spaces 4
        console.error("Strange!"); <- spaces 8 + ; 1 = 9
    }                              <- spaces 4
}                                  <- 0

total = 20 + 1 + 5 + 4 + 9 + 4 = 43

I don't know why the output is 45.

Note: I didn't study your solution. I'm doing the above calculations manually based on the statement only.

Thanks.
realy real! Change statment now
thank you so much
THANKS
not needed
i just rewrite the statement with your suggestions and a complete explanation of cleaning steps

Thank you. There are still some issues not yet addressed:

Goal
* Please add ", newlines are <<not>> deleted)" after "{{//}}".

Input
* Please change "number of line" to "number of lines".

Constraints
* Please mention that comments never appear in the middle of a line except when a line consists of only leading spaces followed by a comment.

Cases
* Please follow up the two points in my last comment (point 1: change the last validator, and point 2: clarify your counting).

Thanks.
I make it, but for middle line comment, if we first delete start and end line spaces, I don't need to clarify this.

That's just because you don't have lines with comments starting in the middle, e.g.

let a = readline(); // read a

The following points are outstanding.

Goal
* Please add ")" after "{{//}}".

Constraints
* Please mention that comments never appear in the middle of a line except when a line consists of only leading spaces followed by a comment.

Cases
* Please follow up the two points in my last comment (point 1: change the last validator, and point 2: clarify your counting).

Feel free to ask if you don't understand any of the above points, since some of the points haven't been acted upon even after a few mentions.

Thanks.
I've done them all :)
Have you clicked the SAVE button after your update, if any? I don't see any changes.
big mistake bro... i'm stupid
done!

Goal
* Please change "Never" to "In this clash, comments never".

Cases
* Validator 4: Please add a comment preceded by some spaces in the code, similar to "Both" (Test 4).

* "Both" (Test 4): Your code does not count 7 characters (the comment "//realy") and hence it outputs 49 instead of 56.

* Validator 4: Your code counts 2 semicolons wrong (in "i=0;i<k;i++") and hence it outputs 50 instead of 48.

* I haven't checked the output for other cases; you'd better double-check each one manually and carefully.

Thanks.
my code outup wath i write on top

Simple questions. Please answer them based on the statement, regardless of what your code does:

* Should you leave "//realy" there and output 49, or should you delete "//realy" and output 56?

* Should you leave "//Last but not least" there and output 30, or should you delete "//Last but not least" and output 50? (These numbers assume that your code has removed two semi-colons correctly. I doubt that, but ignore it for now.)

1: yes i would delete //rely
2: same things
Ok. In that case, please correct your solution code to do just that. Also correct it as your code removes the semi-colons incorrectly in cases like "i=0;i<k;i++".
no longer, it was already corriged
Again I don't see any changes.
manuel just find the bug, that is now corriged
